intro: Canthium golungense var. parviflorum, commonly known as the small-flowered spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous shrub, characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers. Its flowers are usually greenish-yellow, and the plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, disturbed habitats and is often found in lowland areas with rich soil.
